radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have any special marking to distinguish possessors from any other nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, there is no special marking to indicate genitive case.

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the possessor occur with respect to the noun being possessed?

radioGroup.radio: Yes, the head noun within the possessor is syntactically marked via an affix. (Agreement with an affix on the possessed noun, if needed, is also handled by this.)

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the possessor occur with respect to the noun being possessed?

radioGroup.radio: Yes, the whole possessive phrase is syntactically marked via a phrasal clitic. (Agreement with an affix on the possessed noun, if needed, is also handled by this.)

radioGroup.prompt: Is the phrasal clitic written as a separate word?
radioGroup.radio: No, like in English, it attaches to the closest word (can be either the preceding or following word).

radioGroup.prompt: Is this possessive marker required on all possessors (other than pronouns)?
radioGroup.radio: No, it is optional in some cases

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the possessive marker occur with respect to the possessor?
Where does the possessor occur with respect to the noun being possessed?

form.instruction: In the lexicon, mark the affix with the feature genitive.

You need to write a CC table pre-pass that will split the clitic into a separate word. Then add a root entry to your lexicon for that clitic, and add the feature Poss to assure the correct category and genitive case feature for the syntactic parser. [Note that this may be a little more complicated. For example, in English 's can also be the contraction of is or has, so those also need to have root entries and the .ana file will have a three-way ambiguity. The syntactic parser will then disambiguate it. In addition, regular English plurals have a different form for the possessive (e.g. boys'), so the CC table must change ___s' to ___s 's and ___'s to ____ 's.]
In the lexicon, mark this entry with the feature Poss, which will change the category and add the genitive case.
